title: Recupero email
content:
Buongiorno, il mio server di posta ha avuto un problema ed è stato cancellato. Per fortuna io avevo tutte le caselle configurate in imap ed ho fatto una copia del profilo thunderbird prima che la sincronizzazione cancellasse le email dalle varie caselle. Ora ho il profilo in linea con le caselle vuote ed una copia con tutte le email vecchie. Come posso spostare le email dal vecchio profilo a quello nuovo?

Grazie per l'aiuto

Cordiali saluti Filippo
creator: migliorefilippo

title: Thunderbird Backup Task
content: Welcome At first I would like to thank you very much my question is Is there a way to synchronize tasks with the calendar so that when I open Thunderbird from another computer I can see these tasks, as the tasks are stored only on the computer, I do not want to link an external calendar such as Google calendar, etc .... Gratefully
creator: ALSAQRI.DESIGNER

title: Thunderbird has 'lost' all previous emails and does not download new ones.
content:
When going to look at my email one morning, Thunderbird seemed to have lost all my previous emails, except a random 6, all subfolders were missing and it wasn't downloading any new messages. There seemed no apparent reason for this what so ever, as everything was normal the night before.

It is fortunate I have a phone and iPad through which I can access emails, however, attaching or reading some documents isn't always simple on these devices.

I tried Googling solutions, but I'm afraid the jargon got the better of me. Data folder, ImapMail, POPs, MSF...no idea what they are or where to find them on my Mac. One said to go to Tools then select Account Settings. There is no such option in my Thunderbird Tools drop down list.

My brain is wired for arts and languages, not maths and technology, so this is all most frustrating, therefore I am hoping that someone might be able to help, please!
creator: dolly1603

title: Thunderbird incoming mail to trash
content: Tutte le mail che arrivano vanno in cestino, all'apertura del programma sono ormai abituato ad aprire la sola cartella del cestino per leggere le nuove mail arrivate. Non vi sono filtri di indirizzi posta indesiderata. Se provo a spostare la mail su cartella 'arrivo' torna in cestino. L'unico rimedio sembra quello di rinominare il 'cestino' in 'arrivo', non vedo altra soluzione
creator: m4m0

title: Posta Indesiderata, come disattivare il controllo di Thunderbird su posta indesiderata ?
content: Faccio questa domanda dato che tutte le mail nuove in arrivo vengono considerate da Thunderbird come posta indesiderata, vorrei disattivare questo controllo, ed in parte l'ho fatto disattivando 'attiva i controlli incrementali di posta indesiderata ...' ma che sia attivo o disattivo, la mail nuove non arrivano in cartella 'arrivo' ma va a finire nel 'cestino', e se provi a spostarla verso 'arrivo' thunderbird la riporta in 'cestino' dato che e' convinto sia posta indesiderata. Vorrei essere io a decidere quale sia la posta indesiderata o meno, e' troppo semplice considerare ogni mail nuova come posta indesiderata, non vi e' un criterio adeguato cosi.
creator: m4m0

title: Sent messages are stored on Exchange server as draft
content:
I am using Thunderbird 102.7.1 on Ubuntu 22.04. My work email address is on an what I'm pretty sure is an Exchange server (https://outlook.office365.com/EWS/Exchange.asmx) and I sometimes access this email through a Windows computer running Outlook, or through the webmail interface at outlook.office.com/mail, or through the Gmail app on Android.

When I send messages from Thunderbird, the configuration is to "place a copy in "Sent" folder on user@work.com on outlook.office365.com"

However, when I use Outlook or webmail or my phone, the copy is marked as a draft. Any thoughts on why this might be?

It makes things difficult as I can be unsure about whether I really did send the email and I also cannot reply to emails I have sent, so it is hard to maintain good threading of my email.
creator: john.harvey.math

title: mailto:kontor@radioringkobing.dk
content: Dear Thunderbird When we were running Outlook on Windows XP, we could have the following statement: mailto:kontor@radioringkobing.dk, and it would send a mail through Outlook Now we are running Thunderbird on Windows 10, and this feature don't work. We have a costum built program to adresse our members. if we have to use Thunderbird one mail at a time, instead of a bulk job, it will take oceans of time. Best regards Anton Andersen Radio Ringkøbing

title: Mail vanno direttamente nel cestino
content:
Gentili utenti, per la mia azienda uso Mozilla Thunderbird. Da inizio gennaio, improvvisamente, il programma ha deciso di sua spontanea volonta di prendere e spostarlo da solo nel cestino. Ho provato a verificare con la mia mail personale, inviando una mail ed effettivamente dopo 3 secondi, scompare e viene spostata nel cestino. Questo non avviene per tutte le mail, la maggioranza. Non vi e una logica in questo. A caso. Non passano da Junk e non sono neanche considerate spam.

Qualcuno che riesce ad aiutarmi?

title: Tbird v102 Index/Synchronization Hang
content:
Hello hi ya' doin',

Win10 64x, Thunderbird v102 32x, IMAP.

When I launch thunderbird it takes a long time for the password dialog box to open. Check mail, send mail, indexing, synchronize are sluggish and hang in the activity manager. I have to turn off thunderbird and turn it back on to try to get it to work, and even then if it looks like it's open and ready to go, "determining which messages to index" never goes away in the activity manager. This all started when I updated to v102.

So I uninstalled/reinstalled. 1. Backup profile folder. 2. Uninstall via Settings > apps > uninstall thunderbird. 3. Restart. 4. Reinstall thunderbird 102, check for updates. 5. ESET exclusions. I notice on the IMAP computers, Mozilla Thunderbird Folder is in C: Program Files and Mozilla Maintenance Folder is in C: Program Files(x86). On the POP computer both those folders are in (x86). (I don't understand why one installation is one way and the other installation is the another way. It doesn't seem to me like POP vs IMAP have anything to do how the installer installs. But I'm just a layman.) 6. Restart 7. Launch thunderbird and it opened up with all the IMAP and Local folders. I didn't even need the backed up profiles folder.

It was at least 100% better but still never turned off the "determining which messages to index" thermometer in activity manager. That thermometer is always there stuck at full. That was day before yesterday. Now today when I launch thunderbird it hangs when checking mail and gets stuck trying to bring current the sends/receives/moves/deletes I've done on the iphone. It reaches a point and gets stuck. I turn thunderbird off and back on and it reaches another point and gets stuck. Maybe I should re install again but this time ShiftRightClick the installer and Run as Administrator?
creator: scottnell

title: Undesired Archiving of Emails
content: I'm, using TB version 102.7.1 (64-bit) on Windows10. An hour ago I received an email in TB which was displayed perfectly normally. Having read it I moved on to other emails, but then wanted to go back and re-read the first one. In moving out of that first one then returning to it, either it is doing something automatically which I do not want, or probably more likely, I unintentionally, and unknowingly, clicked on something. Either way, that first email was no longer being displayed in my Inbox. After a while of searching I found it sitting all on its own in an obviously automatically newly-created folder labelled 2023, in Archives. I have been using TB for many years, but I have never needed to archive anything and never have intentionally done so. I don't even know how to do this. So although I'm sure that archiving is a very good feature and probably worth doing, I really don't want my emails disappearing from my Inbox without me intentionally shifting them. So how can I prevent this happening again (it was quite an important email)? Did I accidently click on something. If not, is there some setting or other that I need to learn about, please?

title: Attached jpgs not displaying fully inline and only partially downloaded
content:
I am assisting friends. I am in the UK and they are in Gibraltar so am using TeamViewer. All the info relates to their PC. Using Thunderbird version 102.7.1 (32-bit). Only part of attached jpgs are displayed whether inline or when opening the file - e.g. 1.2mb of a 2.4 mb jpg or 1.3 of a 3.3 mb jpg. JPGs of 189 kb and 643 kb work fine. Clearing the cache solves the problem. However after restarting Thunderbird the problem reappears.

Have tried the following with no success: Creating a new profile Uninstalling Thunderbird Installing Thunderbird 64-bit Setting cache to 0 Setting cache to 50 They have reverted to the 32-bit version for the time being.

Strangely when accessing the imap account on my PC there are no problems.

title: Thunderbird Email:  Create a new address book contact by cloning an existing contact
content: Is there a way in the Thunderbird Address Book to create a new address book contact by copying or cloning an existing contact? If not, that would be a helpful option in cases where an existing contact has all of the business name, address, website, company phone number, etc. Much of this information would be the same for a new contact at that business, so cloning existing data would save a lot of re-typing. Also in cases like this, it would be very handy to view the details of an existing contact while at the same time typing details into a separate window to create a new contact. Thanks!

creator: tomed6869

title: Reinstallation of Thunderbird on new computer has Network Protocol Error/Authentication Failure
content: Have successfully installed and used Thunderbird on new desktop computers multiple times, but can't do final step(s) on this one. Mail provider is Gmail, ISP is (Emporia KS) ValuNet Fiber, using Windows 10 Pro, Malwarebytes anti-virus and firewall. Download and installation of latest version of Thunderbird works fine, including automatic recognition of account. As shown by attached images, normal home page is present, except dot beside "Inbox" at extreme upper left keeps on bouncing, and (attached image of) Google sign-in window immediately appears. Use of Google password then results in error messages of "Authentication failure while connecting to server" or "Network Protocol Error". As shown by attached image, SMTP settings are correct. All other Internet (via both WiFi and Ethernet) work fine, as does installation and use of (non-preferred) Outlook mail provider. Troubleshooting efforts of multiple attempts of uninstall and new downloads, obtaining new Google password, manual setting of server settings (including trying POP), and shutdown of Malwarebytes have proven ineffective. ValuNet Fiber ISP has checked incoming service and pronounces it in good order. What am I missing? Thanks.
creator: gladowd
